hotspots.label: Long Bean Pod
hotspots.fact: This is a yard-long bean, also called an asparagus bean! These beans grow much longer than regular green beans and can reach up to 3 feet long. They're popular vegetables in Asian cooking and grow on climbing vines.

hotspots.label: Climbing Vine Structure
hotspots.fact: This plant uses curling tendrils to grab onto the wooden fence for support as it grows upward. This climbing ability helps the plant reach sunlight while saving space in gardens!

hotspots.label: Yellow Flowers
hotspots.fact: These yellow flowers will develop into the bean pods we see below! Flowers are important because they contain the plant's reproductive parts and must be pollinated before beans can grow.

hotspots.label: Wooden Fence Support
hotspots.fact: Gardeners use fences and trellises to support climbing plants like this bean vine. This helps the plant grow vertically, keeps beans off the ground, and makes harvesting easier!
